prompt: <description>**Part 1: A long, thin, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, narrowing slightly towards the top.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. On this sketch, perform the following actions: Sketch face 1: - Loop 1: Create a sequence of lines and arcs as follows (include the direction of each curve in your mental model): - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0037, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0037, 0.0], End Point [0.0037, 0.0262] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0037, 0.0262], End Point [0.03, 0.0262] - Line 4: Start Point [0.03, 0.0262], End Point [0.03, 0.03] - Line 5: Start Point [0.03, 0.03], End Point [0.0, 0.03] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.03], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop, ensuring the first and last points are coincident. This creates a closed loop with 6 lines and curves, forming the boundary of the sketch's face. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate_system defined earlier. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector to a depth of 0.75 units (opposite direction of the normal), using the sketch_scale parameter 0.03. This results in a 3D shape with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.03 (~30 mm) - Width: 0.75 (75 mm) - Height: 0.03 (~30 mm) You have now completed constructing part 1. Continue by following the instructions for part 2, part 3, etc., if provided in the CAD Assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description><part\\_1> Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom. The hole is centered along the vertical axis of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 1 unit by 1 unit. The hole has a diameter of 0.5 units. The prism is positioned in the center of the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and the Translation Vector to (0.0, 0.0625, 0.0). Now, create the 2D sketch for the first face of the prism. The face has a single loop consisting of 5 line segments and 1 circle. 1. Line Segment: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.75, 0.0) 2. Line Segment: Start Point (0.75, 0.0), End Point (0.5938, 0.1562) 3. Line Segment: Start Point (0.5938, 0.1562), End Point (0.3125, 0.1562) 4. Arc: Start Point (0.3125, 0.1562), Mid Point (0.1875, 0.2812), End Point (0.0625, 0.1562) 5. Line Segment: Start Point (0.0625, 0.1562), End Point (0.0, 0.1562) 6. Circle: Center Point (0.1875, 0.1562), Radius = 0.0625 The additional circle in the sketch represents the cylindrical hole in the prism. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale provided. In this case, the scaling parameter is 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model, creating a new solid body. The extrusion depth toward the normal should be 0.0625, and there should be no extrusion in the opposite direction. The height of the final prism shape is 0.75 units. Provide this information as instructions to the junior CAD designer. By following these steps, they should be able to generate a parametric CAD model that aligns with the given JSON file.</description>
